result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K John was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 09:52 AM Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells.  Defendant Brian K John in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - defendant is on loan from DOC, here for sentencing after the defendant was found guilty at jury trial. Court has reviewed the file, no PSI ordered and neither party has filed a sentencing memorandum. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - will be asking that the defendant not be allowed for any programs and that this sentence run consecutive to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving - on count #2 - recommending 10 years in the WI Statr Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, count #2 - recommending 10 years in the WI Statr Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurent to count #1, count #3 - recommending 10 years in the WI Statr Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to #1 and #2, count #4 - recommending 10 years in the WI Statr Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - consecutivre to count #1, #2 and #3, count #5 - recommending 10 years in the WI Statr Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to #5 but consecutive to counts #1, #2 and #3 and consecutive to any sentence that the defendant may be serving now. Court has clarification question on count #5 regarding it being concurrent and consecutive. State responds and confirms. Van Ellis makes argument prior to his recommendation - asks that the Court make him eligible for ERP - recommends 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES on all counts - concurrent to each other and to any other sentence that the defendant may be serving - credit for 669 days if the counts are run concurrent and if counts are run concurrent, sentence credit would be 150 days and again ask that the Court make him eligible for ERP. John makes statement. State makes additional comments in regards to defendant's comment. Van Elis responds. Defendant makes additional statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on all counts - 9 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - consecutive to any sentence that he is currnetly serving; on counts #1, #2 and #3 - concurrent to each other, counts #4 and #5 - concurrent to each other but consecutive to counts #1, #2 and #3, will not allow him to be eligible for any programs, costs on each count - to be paid with any prison wages/funds due him while incarcerated, any ES rules to be set by P&P, submit DNA sample, felony rights given, right to appeal, credit for 150 days (stipulated), adjourned.

#1 - Photo of Documented Buy Money (3/28/15); #2 - Evidence Photos (3/28/15); #3 - Lab Findings (3/28/15); #4 - CI146 Statement (3/28/15); #5 - Photo of Documented Buy Money (4/22/15); #6 - Evidence Photos (4/22/15); #7 Lab Findings (4/22/15); #9 - DVD - phone call recording; #11 - Lab Analyst Qualifications; #12 - JOC 11CF42 from Brown County; #13 - Evidence bag containing cocaine; #14 - Evidence bag containing oxycodon pills; #15 - MUVI (3/28/15); #16 - MUVI (4/22/15); #17 - Transmittal from Crime Lab; #18 - Receipt from Crime Lab; #19 - Evidence Release Form - Return (03/28/15); #20 - Evidence Release - Return (3/28/15); #21 - Reciept from Crime Lab (4/22/15); #22 - Transmittal from Crime Lab (4/22/15)    NOTE: All exhibits were scanned and destroyed except for DVD's and evidence bags (#13 & #14), which are located in exhibit box in vault.

09:48 AM Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells.  Defendant Brian K John in custody but appears in street clothes today for the JT.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge welcomes jurors. Clerk swears all jurors in. Voir dire by Court begins. Voir dire by State (10:09 AM). Jurors have been picked and sworn. Jurors have left courtroom (10:47 AM). Recess at 10:47 AM. Back on record at 11:09 AM with jurors present. Court has previously sequestored witnesse. Court gives jury instructions. State makes opening statement (11:32 AM). Defense makes opening statement (11:40 AM). State calls Detective Sgt. Tom Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 11:46 AM. Direct exam by State. Jurors leave courtroom at 11:58 AM. State asks that Court receive exhibits #11 and #12 that were previously offered in MIL. Court receives after no objections (11:59 PM). State put sidebar on the record (12:01 PM). Recess at 12:03 PM. Recalled at 1:10 PM with jurors present. Direct exam of Det. Sgt Tom Robinson continues by State and reminded that he is stil under oath. State offers exhibit #1 - document buy money (photo). Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (1:15 PM). Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:25 PM). State offers exhibit #2 - evidence photos. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (1:28 PM). State offers exhibit #13 - sealed evidence of cocain and 2 oxy pills (blue). Court receives exhibit #13 after no objections (1:29 PM). State is allowed to publish exhibit #2 (no objections). State offers exhibit #17 - Transmittal of Criminal Evidence for 3/28/15. Court receives exhibit #17 after no objections (1:37 PM). State offers exhibit #18 - receipt from crime lab for 3/28/15. State offers exhibit #19 - Evdence Return Receipt. Court receives exhibit #19 after no objections (1:37 PM). State offers exhibit #3 - Lab findings of 3/28/15. VanElls objects - not qualified - overruled at this point (1:39 PM). Subject to VanElls objection - Court receives exhibit #3 (1:40 PM). State offers exhibit #15 - Audio/Video of 3/28/15 controlled buy. Court receices exhibit #15 after no objections. State offers exhibit #16 - Audio/Video of 4/22/15 controlled buy. Court receices exhibit #16 after no objections (1:43 PM). State will be playing exhibits #15 and #16, court reporter not taking down any notes from CD's. State offers exhibit #9 - Phone call log DVD from defendant. Jurors exit courtroom at 1:54 PM. Court hears objection to the admission of exhibit #9. Jurors -re-enter courtroom at 2:10 PM. Direct exam of Robinson continues. VanElls withdraws it;s objection in regards to exhibit #9. Court receives exhibit #9 after objection was withdrawn (2:10 PM). State plays parts of exhibit #9. State offers exhibit #5 - Photo of document buy money (4/22/15). Court receives exhibit #5 after no objections (2:24 PM). State offers exhibit #6 - Evident photos (4/22/15). Court receives exhibit #6 after no objections (2:25 PM). State offers exhibit #14 - oxycodone (12's & 15's). Court receives exhibit #14 after no objections (2:26). State publishes #6 and #14 to jurors. Court accepts exhibits #6 & #14, after no objections (2:30). State offers exhibit #20 - Evidence release, #21 - Receipt from crime lab for 4/22/15 incident & #22 - Transmittal from crime lab. Court accepts exhibits #20, #21 & #22  after no objections (2:31 PM). State offers exhibit #7 - 4/22/15 lab findings. Van Ells objects - same basis as previously - overruled (2:32 PM). Cross exam by VanElls at 2:33 PM. Re-direct by State at 2:55 PM. Re-cross  by VanElls at 2:57 PM. Re-direct by State at 2:59 PM. Robinson excused at 3:00 PM. State calls Katie Hoffmeyer. Hoffmeyer sworn in at 3:01 PM. Direct exam by State. Court receives exhibit #3 after objection was withdrawn by defense counse (3:07 PM). Court receives exhibit #7 after objection was withdrawn by defense counsel (3:10 PM). Cross exam by VanElls at 3:11 PM. Re-direct by State at 3:14 PM. Re-cross by defense counsel at 3:15 PM. Hoffmeyer released from subpoena. State releases witness Andy Karcz. No objections by VanElls. Recess at 3:15 PM. Back on record with jurors present at 3:37 PM. State calls Dtc. Sgt. Darrell Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 3:37 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by VanElls at 3:46 PM. Re-direct by State at 3:50 PM. Re-cross by VanElls at 3:50 PM. Wilson excused at 3:52 PM. State calls Gary Williams. Williams sworn in at 3:53 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by VanElls at 4:06 PM. Re-direct by State at 4:09 PM. Williams excused at 4:10 PM and is released from his subpoena. State calls Charlie Ward. Ward sworn in at 4:11 PM. Cross exam by VanElls at 4:29 PM. Ward excused from his subpoena. State rests with it's right to call rebuttal witnesses. Jurors leave Courtroom at 4:36 PM. Recess at 4:38 PM. Back on recorrd at 4:51 PM without the jurors present. Court does collaquey with defendant in regards to his decision to not testify. Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarly and intelligently waived his right to testify, is satisfied with representation of VanElls. VanElls believes his client understands his right to not testify. Defense makes motion to dismiss all charges for stated reasons. State makes argument for the denial of the motion for stated reasons. Court denies motion. Off record to go thru jury insstructions (4:59 PM). Back on record at 5:15 PM without jurors present. Court and counsel go thru jury instructions. Off record at 5:21 PM. Back on record at 6:13 PM with jurors present. Defense rests. State makes closing argument (6:13 PM). Defense counsel makes closing argument (6:27 PM). Rebuttal by State (6:38 PM). Jurors excused for supper at 6:44 PM. Court goes thru jury instructions. Back on record at 7:08 PM with jurors present. Court gives jury instructions. Jurors leave for deliberations at 7:34 PM. Recess at 7:36 PM. Back on record at 8:04 PM with jurors present. Court has the clerk read the veridick, Guilty on all 5 counts, jury polled and agrees it was their verdict. State moves not withstanding verdict. Court grants finding of guilty according to the jury. State would like to adjourn to sentencing and is not requesting PSI. Defense would like to proceed to sentencing. Court - will set sentencing for another date. State is asking court to remand to FC jail. Court revokes bond and remands to the FC jail. Parties to contact JA's to schedule for sentencing. Adjourned 8:12 PM.

08:48 AM Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells.  Defendant Brian K John in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court brings up a couple of issues. Jury instructions - subject to changed due to Amended Informtion filed. Proceedure on jury instructions. State would like to discuss amended information, drop/delete maintaining a drug trafficking place. Van Ells does not object to dismissing drug trafficking place and does not object to the amended information. Court will change jury instructions. Court - motion to return bond to poster. Van Ells makes statement regarding bond. State does not object to release of the bond and for new bond to be addressed at the conclusion of the trial today. Van Ells does not object. Court releases bond to the poster. State comfortable with jury instructions proposed. Van Ells - would like to address prior convictions of witnesses. Court questions parties. State would prefer to be read. Van Ells agrees. Van Ells - lay witnesses - prior convictions of witnesses. Court questions how old prior convictions are. State responds. Van Ells believes all convictions should all be counted. Court - will go back 10 years (11 prior OAR total of 26 prior convictions for one of the witnesses). Court explains potential jury proceedures. No objections. Court - jury instructions. State - stipulation to a prior 961 conviction (exhibit #12) be redacted and repeater allegation. Van Ells agrees with no mention of repeater allegations. Court goes over instruction #155 and makes changes as stated on the record. Areas that are struck will be deleted. Instruction #6030 no objection to removing portion of that instruction regarding street name of drugs. Van Ells asks to be ommitted from opening statements. Removing instruction #6030B. Instruction #6202  - striking street name. Jury decision - discussion - add possession of oxicodone. Van Ells - no objection to the addition on jury decision verbage. Court indicates what is read prior and after trial. State submits exhibit #11 and #12 after no objections - stipulation. Van Ells agrees and does not object to the submission of exhibit #11 & 12. Van Ells asks for sequestration of witnesses. State - asks for Detective Tom Robinson to remain in court room as assisting in the case. Van Ells does not object. Court - so orders.  State questions if jury will be able to take notes and questions. Discussion regarding. Court - will allow juror questions and note taking. Adjourned 9:32 AM.
Bail/bond hearing on January 10, 2019 at 08:30 am.

11:42 AM Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court.  No appearance by defendant. Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is being held in WI State Prison system and state indicates that they did not writ as there was no resolution to case. Another case in Brown Co and would like to proceed with trial date as already scheduled. Van Ellis makes statement complex issues in Brown Co and status is set there December 10th. Asks for another PTC via phone. Standard motions in limine by both parties. Van Ellis maybe arguing states MIL as for deadline for filing DE witness list - state has no objection to setting date for DE witness list. Motions to be heard the day of trial. Discovery has been completed both parties agree. If any resolution notify the court prior to JT. State asks for plea prior to JT date. State/atty Van Ells has no objection to meet in Shawano if plea is given court will keep that in mind. JT to start promptly and parties will be in chambers at 8:30. Standard jury instructions. State will writ here for JT. Adjourned 11:51 am.

Pre-trial conference on December 4, 2018 at 11:45 am.
Jury trial on January 10, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:07 PM. Called 15CF72 and 17CF73. State - defendant is currently incarcerated in the Door County Jail on a ES hold. Ellis agrees, he is on a ES hold until 9/12/18 per a letter from the defendant and that the defendant wishes the matter be set for a JT. State has no objectoions. Court sets both matters for a JT on 1/10/19 and a telephonic PTC on 12/4/18 at 11:45 AM. Court continues bond on both cases.  Jury trial scheduled for January 10, 2019 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2018 at 11:45 am.
Final pre-trial on August 7, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 8, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Bond poster requesting bond be returned to her.
Granting Motion to Withdraw as Defendant's Counsel
Status conference on February 8, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Kussel appears via video from Shawano County. Called at 2:50 PM. Diaz makes his argument for his motion to withdraw. Court makes comment that there is not a court reporter. Recalled at 2:55 PM with a court reporter available now. Diaz makes his argument again for his motion to withdraw as counsel, have prepared a Order for Court's signature if motion is granted. Court asks questions of defendant, confirms the defendant's address. Defendant responds. Diaz shows Clerk proof of a letter that he sent to the defendant that was returned with no mail receptacle. John verifies his address, numbers were backwards. Clerk has address on both of the defendant's open cases of N6261 Onodoga Drive, Oneida, WI. Diaz makes additional argument. John states he wants a different attorney for stated reasons. Court makes statement, explains to the defendant that allowing the withdrawal of the attorney will delay the case again. John states he does not want to delay case. John does not have any objections to the Court granting the withdrawal of the counsel. Court will allow the withdrawal of counsel and will sign the order when it receives it (Clerk will fax). Court sets this matter for a STC on 2/8/18 at 10:00 AM. Court continues bond on this matter.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on February 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on February 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez who both appear telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:03 PM. Court - here for STC. Diaz puts on the record that the defendant's previous attorney withdrew and he was contacted by SPD to represent the defendant on this matter and his other matter in front of Judge Stenz and is willing to do so, has seen and reviewed all necessary materials and discovery in regards to this case, asking for Court to consider allowing him some extra time to go thru everything with the defendant and to talk to State regarding all matters. Court has reviewed file as well, is an old case, wants to know how defense counsel and State want to proceed, another FPT or JT. Diaz is asking for a PTC with State to possibly do a global resolution. Clerk prefers setting the matter for a JT on 2/13/18 and working backwards on setting a PTC. Diaz and State agree. Court refers to State in regards to how they work on PTC. State responds, defense counsel needs to make an appointment to discuss the matter with the State. Diaz makes statement in regards to the distance he would have to travel, wants to communicate by email. State prefers telephonic connection and finalize with email. Court continues bond, sets this matter for JT, PTC will happen via telephone between counsel.  Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Status conference rescheduled to 11/7/17 @ 11:45 am. Brian John
Status conference on November 7, 2017 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian K John
Current: 405 North Main Street, c/o Shawano County Jail, Shawano, WI 54166 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2017)
Prior: N6261 Onodaga Drive, Oneida, WI 54155 United States
Status conference on November 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer whop appears telephonically.  Defendant Brian K John in custody and appears via video from Shawano County Jail.  Charles James Simono does not appear with leave of the Court. Called at 10:27 AM. This matter is FTR due to court reporter's equipment failure. Court asks the defendant why he is in custody. Defendant responds, was picked up in Keshena and was just transported yesterday to Shawano County yesterday. Court explains to the defendant what the hearing is about today. Schaefer makes argument for her motion to withdraw. Court allows the defendant to make a comment in regards to the motion, does not object to the withdrawal as he wants someone who is capable of representing him fully. Court asks questions of counsel in regards to her ability to both represent this defendant and comply with her Supreme Court case. Schaefer responds. Court will allow a recess to allow the attorney to talk to her client (10:39 AM). Back on record at 10:46 AM. Court will allow the motion for withdrawal of counsel but it is hesitantly for stated reasons. Court will continue bond and will use the 11/8/17 court date as a STC and new counsel can appear if appointed. Court orders Schaefer to contact SPD today and let them know that she has been withdrawn as counsel of record. Schaefer believes she already sent an order for signature. Court reviews file. Court has signed the Order. Adjourned at 10:51 AM.  Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
in support of motion to withdraw as counsel
Jury trial on November 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court and appears via video from Door County Jail in Shawano County with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin and appears telephonically from Forest County. Judge Kussel appears telephonically from Shawano County. Called at 9:33 AM. Court updates case, asks Schaefer to state her motion. Schaefer states motion for adjourment of trial. Court makes statement in regards to it taking a while to get the case back on the calendar due to it being an out-of-county assignment. Schaefer understands. Simono - not really objecting to the continuance but wants to make a response in regards to the reasons presented for the adjournment. Court makes decision on motion for continuance - grants the continuance, bond continues, vacate the Order to Produce. Off record at 9:44 for scheduling. Back on record at 9:45 AM. Court sets the matter for another 2-day JT.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Continuance of Trial

Judge Kussel appears by telephone from Shawano County Courtroom. Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court and appears by telephone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:21 AM. Schaefer had filed a motion to withdraw due to not being able to have contact with defendant. Court questions is Schaefer is still able to represent him now that the where abouts of her client and puts on the record the issues with the case. State has file a motion to adjourn for stated reasons and the offer will not change. Court questions Schaefer. Schaefer withdraws her motion for withdrawal of counsel. Court questions if the JT date can proceed. State does not object to the JT proceeding. Schaefer small issue with finding detective but beleives it could proceed. Court will schedule a FPT. State will provide a writ for the defendant and requires 5 day notice before trial if there is a change of plea. Schaefer understands and feels that may be possible. Adjourned 11:31 AM.
in Support of Notice of Motion and Motion for Withdrawal of Counsel
Cover letter from Atty. Schaefer regarding Withdrawl of Counsel

Defendant Brian K John in court, in custody from FOSO with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer appearing by phone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:37 AM. Judge Kussel appears via telephone. Motion filed by Schaefer for bond reduction. Schaefer updates court on status of case and unable to post bond and person whom posted bond wanted her bond money back - argues bond was not due to misconduct and also difficulties to work with client due to location. State objects for reasons as stated on the record. Schaefer responds. Court questions Schaefer regarding being appointed, trial prep and location. Court denies motion, bond continues and advises Schaefer can re-file motion with details, if any problems with communicating with her client in FOSO in any matter.
Bail/bond hearing on April 17, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Brian K John in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:38 PM. State - here for bond motion hearing filed by defense counsel. Attorney Schaefer agrees and makes argument for lower cash bond (less than $1,000.00) or signature bond - states reasons. State - bond - objects to complete bond reduction to signature bond, believes some cash is necessary and would like at least $5000.00 cash bond. Schaefer responds. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $2500.00 with all conditions to remain in effect.
Bail/bond hearing on February 27, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bond
Jury trial on July 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:23 AM. Judge Kussel appears via telephone from Shawano County. Court reviews file, here for PTC as JT is scheduled for 2/27/17 and a bail bond hearing as the poster has requested that the bond be returned. The defendant understands that if the bond is returned to the poster, that he would go back into custody. Court reviews the filing. Schaefer states that she received full discovery last Thursday. The status conference today was to see if counsel would be ready to proceed to trial on 2/28/17. Schaefer states that she has not had any contact with the defendant, all appointments have fallen thru. Schaefer informs the Court why there has not been any contact yet, one time the defendant stated that he did not have a ride and he didn't show on the other appointment and she does not know why. Schaefer not really ready for JT at this point for stated reasons. The poster is present in the courtroom. If Court grants the poster's request, then the defendant would be available to meet with as he will be incarcerated. Schaefer agrees but prefers that the defendant not go back into custody. Court - no formal request for a continuance at this point but it is possible that it will be forthcoming, will know within a week, can't make that determination today. State is ready to go on for the two day trial, all witnesses have been subpoenaed. Schaefer responds, has not filed any witness list yet as she has not met with the defendant yet, does have discovery. Schaefer states that she would tentatively be able to proceed to trial if she met with her client. Court will assume that it is going to trial on 2/27/17, meet in chambers at 8:30 AM on 2/27/17 and have jury instructions filed at least 5 days prior to trial. State - general MIL. Schaefer - standard MIL as well. Court requests all parties to contact their non-professional witnesses in regards to abiding by their subpoenaes at least 5 days prior to trial. If the matter settles, Court needs to be contact no later than the morning before the trial otherwise jury costs will be assessed to a party. State expects any settlement one week prior to the scheduled JT. Court addresses the refund of the bond posted. Bond poster, Theresa Johnson, is in the Courtroom. Court questions poster in regards to the bond posted. Johnson is asking that the bond be returned to her for stated reasons and she understands that if granted, the defendant would go back into custody today. Schaefer objects to the refund of the bond or convert it to a signature bond for stated reasons. State objects to a signature bond for stated reasons, has no objections to refunding the bond, wants the $10,000.00 cash bond to stay in effect. Court grants the poster's request, refund the bond to poster, continues bond as previously set at $10,000.00 cash, defendant to go back into custody today if he does not have the money to post. State reminds counsel to contact FOSO for visits as their policies have changed.  Adjourned.
from poster requesting her bond money back.
Bail/bond hearing on February 7, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Jury trial on February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:37 AM. Court has received information from Attorney Dodge due to personal issues, understand this matter will be re-set, Attorney Dodge could not get a hold of his client. Attorney Dodge agrees and states why on the record. Dodge has not spoken to his client today yet. Court reminds parties that there was a speedy trial demand. Dodge aware but also aware that he posted bond. State has no objections adjourning the matter given the reasons stated by Attorney Dodge. John allowed to make a statement, asking that Attorney Dodge withdraw from the case. Dodge understands and has no objections to withdrawing from the case, has already contacted SPD for them to start a search for another attorney. John is to contact SPD on is own and provide SPD with working number. Court grants defendant's request for withdrawal of counsel, effective today, Dodge to prepare order for his signature. Attorney Dodge released from call. State wants to set for JT so that new counsel can be appointed and keep case on track. Court continues bond. Court sets this matter for PTC on 2/7/17 and JT on 2/27/17 and 2/28/17(back-up trial).  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 09:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Judge Kussel appears telephonically from Shawano County along with Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge appearing telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:43 PM. Dodge has not had contact with John. Dodge is requesing continuance of jury trial scheduled on 12/13/16 due to medical emergency, however speedy disposition was requested. Dodge indicates medial emergency and no contact with Brian John, SPD in Rhinelander has informed Dodge they are looking for new attorney. State indicates John has been released and posted bond. Court questions if on extended supervision why contact has not been established through probation. Dodge responds and last contact with defendant was earlier this summer. Dodge is asking to withdraw from case at this point. Court will not allow withrawl at this point. State makes statement in regards to jury trial. Dodge responds. Court will continue with jury trial at this point.

Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge in court who appears telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:43 PM. State - defendant is not in Court, no WRIT prepared. Dodge states he has not been able to meet with the defendant and will try and arrange a phone conference call or personal visit with him wherever he is incarcerated at. Court reminds parties that the matter is currently set for a JT on 6/9/16. Clerk reminds the State that he will be asking for an adjournment on that date due to his unavailabilty (training). Dodge has no objections to that. Court will grant the adjournment. Counsel to contact JA Casteel and Clerk Carter to schedule a JT, continues bond at this point. State will need to prepare WRIT.

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson - who appears telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Brian K John in custody - and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:16 AM. Erickson states that she was just appointed to the case, needs pleadings from the state. Court reviews file as to where the case is currently at. State puts on the record that an offer was extended and will still be available until the FPT. Erickson requests discovery and the offer as she has nothing on this file at this point. Courts sets for FPT and JT. Defendant states that he was revoked and sentenced. State - bond - asks that bond stay in effect as is. Erickson makes argument for lower cash bond. Court continues bond as is for stated reasons.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Public defender's office can not find an attorney to represent; they requested the Court appoint someone

Defendant Brian K John in court, in custody with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Kussel appears via video/phone. Called 3:13 PM. Here for motion hearing - motion to withdraw filed by Richards. State indicates he has filed motion in limine and is just standard to be heard before jury trial. Richards indicates why he has filed the motion to withdraw, defendant indicated he does not want Richards as an attorney and asks the court to allow Richards to withdraw. John indicates he no longer wants Richards to represent him and in regards to the speedy trial and a jury trial is scheduled. Court indicates jury trial would be nearly impossible to be held, no time for the attorney to prepare. John understands. Court will have to adjourn the JT date. Richards indicates he does not even have discovery due to him being the third attorney on this case and not able to represent him on the 1/7/16 date due to being out of the country. John would like to withdraw his speedy trial demand. Court accepts withdrawl of speedy trial demand. Court will allow counsel to withdraw from this case. State - makes court aware that this is his 3rd attorney on this case and revocation is hearing is scheduled 1/12/16 and asks for this to be heard as status, possible the day of the JT. Richards indicates SPD is in process of appointing attorney. Bond continued. Judge to appear via video from Shawano County.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sent email to JA's and DA

Defendant Brian K John in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Brian K John in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:20 PM. State - proceeding with PH. State asking Court to take judicial notice of the JOC from Brown County Case #11CF42 as it has not received a copy of the JOC yet. Richards objects to the court taking judicial notice at this point. Court views CCAP records and will take judicial notice of the JOC of the defendant from Brown County Case #11CF42. State calls Lt. Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 1:25 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Richards at 1:40 PM. Re-direct by State at 1:44 PM. Robinson excused at 1:46 PM. State calls Charlie Ward. Ward sworn in at 1:46 PM. Direct exam by State.  Cross exam by Richards at 1:49 PM. Ward excused at 1:54 PM and is released from his subpoena. State rests. Defense has no witnesses. State makes closing argument, asks for bind over. Richards - let court make ruling on evidence. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Richards has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to sentencing, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas, continues bond, set for FPT at this point. Richards plans on filing a speedy trial demand. Parties to work with both JA's for a date for 1 day JT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
